item.title: Just a quick question...quick answer please :p
item.dc:creator: @kampeao kampeao
item.description:
@kampeao wrote:

Alright, it’s solved…actually,it makes a little sense…what does not make sense is that i can’t put the } in the end… i don’t know why,since i opened it in the switch(objectID) {
Anyway, here’s how it is now…thanks for the help:

[code]switch (objectID) {
case 13640:
toX = 3006;
toY = 3363;
sM(“You were teleported to Falador”);
break;

	case 10782:
			toX = 3208;
			toY = 3428;
			sM ("You were teleported to Varrock");
		break;[/code]

What i like more/best about this community is that when someone post a problem, he get’s an answer in 5 minutes xD
Solved,thanks
Edit: i jut saw the rep option, whats that? xD

Read full topic

item.title: Just a quick question...quick answer please :p
item.dc:creator: @LKCTheReturn LKCTheReturn
item.description:
@LKCTheReturn wrote:

replace it with this:

[code]
switch (objectID) {
case 13640:
toX = 3006;
toY = 3363;
sM(“You were teleported to Falador”);
break;

            case 10782:
                            toX = 3208;
                            toY = 3428;
                    break;
            }[/code]

Your problem is that you didn’t need the extra switch(objectid)

item.title: Just a quick question...quick answer please :p
item.dc:creator: @kampeao kampeao
item.description:
@kampeao wrote:

So,i had this:

switch (objectID) { case 13640: toX = 3006; toY = 3363; sM("You were teleported to Falador"); break;
Then i added another one and now it’s like this:

[code]switch (objectID) {
case 13640:
toX = 3006;
toY = 3363;
sM(“You were teleported to Falador”);
break;

	switch (objectID) {
	case 10782:
			toX = 3208;
			toY = 3428;
		break;
	}[/code]

My question: When i compile i get this:

client.java:6928: unreachable statement switch (objectID) { ^
What’s wrong?
btw, shouldn’t i need a } for the first case? i think i should, but i don’t…
anyway,what’s wrong?
Edit:the first code is right, i only got the error when i did the second code

Read full topic
